title: Requires rent reduction in cases of submetered utility service
summary: Requires rent reduction in cases of submetered utility service; directs the division of housing and community renewal to develop a standard reduction and an appeals process.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          493

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. GIBSON, CRESPO, SPANO, JEFFRIES, CASTRO, BOYLAND
         -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. AUBRY, DenDEKKER, GLICK,  GOTTFRIED,
         HOOPER, PRETLOW, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Housing

       AN ACT to amend the multiple dwelling law, in relation to rent reduction
         in cases of submetered utility service

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The multiple dwelling  law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 302-d to read as follows:
    3    S  302-D.  PROVISIONS RELATING TO MULTIPLE DWELLINGS WITH SUBMETERING.
    4  1. ANY TENANT RESIDING IN A BUILDING WHICH IS SUBJECT TO SUBMETERING  OF
    5  UTILITIES SHALL RECEIVE A REDUCTION IN RENT WHICH IS EQUAL TO THE AMOUNT
    6  OF  THE  UTILITY  COSTS FOR WHICH SUCH TENANT IS RESPONSIBLE, WHERE SUCH
    7  COSTS WERE PREVIOUSLY INCLUDED IN SUCH TENANT'S RENT.
    8    2. THE DIVISION OF HOUSING AND COMMUNITY RENEWAL SHALL, WITHIN  NINETY
    9  DAYS  OF  THE  EFFECTIVE  DATE  OF THIS SECTION, REVIEW THE STANDARD AND
   10  ACTUAL RENT REDUCTIONS  FOR  SUBMETERED  PROPERTIES  AND  SHALL  REQUIRE
   11  INCREASES  WHERE  THE  DIVISION DETERMINES NECESSARY. THE DIVISION SHALL
   12  DEVELOP A PROCESS FOR TENANTS TO APPEAL THEIR RENT REDUCTION IF IT  DOES
   13  NOT  ACCURATELY  REFLECT  THE AMOUNT THEY ARE REQUIRED TO PAY FOR SUBME-
   14  TERED UTILITIES.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00201-01-1
